New Records: This is the first time since 6 February, 2000 (vs South Africa) that Ghana has lost a game at the Kumasi sports stadium.
Key Match Events: Felicio Milson scored a last-minute goal in the 93rd minute to secure a 1-0 victory for Angola.
Ghana defender Abdul Mumin failed to clear a cross, leading to Milson's goal.
Angola's substitutes combined to secure all three points.
Ghana fans booed the players after the full-time whistle.
Pre-Game Insights: Angola coach Pedro Goncalves stated that his team had the experience to defeat the Black Stars in their backyard.
Post-Match Reflections: The result secured revenge for Angola after losing to a similar late goal in Kumasi during the 2023 Afcon qualifiers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sudan leads Group F with three points after beating Niger. Angola also has three points, while Ghana and Niger are at the bottom of the table after the first round of matches.
Ghana will travel to play Niger in their next group game in four days.
